suncertify.server

Class BrokerLocalServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.server.BrokerServer
      • suncertify.server.BrokerLocalServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BrokerServerIF

    public class BrokerLocalServer
extends BrokerServer
    The BrokerLocalServer class is a singleton which servers as the application server when the application is run in stand-alone mode. It is a subclass of BrokerServer.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    BrokerServer

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws BrokerServerException
        This method starts the server. In this case where the server is a non-network server, all that is required is to get the reference to the database access object.
        Specified by:
        startServer in class BrokerServer
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - If there was an error encountered during the start startup process.

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
        This method does nothing but is needed since the baseclass expects all subclasses to implement their own server stoppage routine.
        Specified by:
        stopServer in class BrokerServer
